00015 #define _STREETRACE_H_

00017 #include <QList>
00018 #include <QString>
00019 #include <QStringList>
00020 #include <QSize>
00021 #include "TraceView/TreeTracers/CGeneralMTracer.h"

00023 struct STreeCall;
00024 struct SGeneralMLine;

00026 
00027 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00028 /// STreeTrace
00029 ///
00030 /// @description  The STreeTrace struct is the data structure used to represent
00031 ///               the trace of a tree. While traces are usually displayed in a
00032 ///               two dimensional grid that is now how the data is stored. The
00033 ///               grid is a representation of a depth first search of a tree of
00034 ///               calls, and thus the data for the trace is stored in just such
00035 ///               a tree.
00036 ///               The STreeTrace has attributes to store the data created from a
00037 ///               trace. It stores the name of the tracer as well as its column
00038 ///               headings. The other attribute is a list of calls that
00039 ///               represent the different depths used in an Iterative-Deepening
00040 ///               (ID) trace. If the trace is not ID then there will only be one
00041 ///               entry in the list.
00042 ///
00043 /// @limitations  This is a struct. It is meant as a way of combining data, but
00044 ///               it provides no encapsulation or data hiding. This has definite
00045 ///               speed benefits but sacrifices most forms of error checking.
00046 ///
00047 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00048 struct STreeTrace
00049 {
00050     STreeTrace();
00051     ~STreeTrace();
00052 
00053     //This variable is the name of the tracer algorithm that created this trace.
00054     QString             s_aiName;
00055 
00056     //This variable is a list of the names or headers for each column. It is
00057     //often used to get a count() of how many columns there are in the trace.
00058     QStringList         s_columnNames;
00059 
00060     //This variable represent the different depths used in an
00061     //Iterative-Deepening(ID) trace. If the trace is not ID then there will only
00062     //be one entry in the list.
00063     QList<STreeCall *>  s_depths;
00064 };
00065 
00066 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00067 /// STreeCall
00068 ///
00069 /// @description  The STreeCall class represents a call in the algorithm. The
00070 ///               calls themselves form a tree, and the grid that is a displayed
00071 ///               trace is a depth first search representation of this grid.
00072 ///               The STreeCall has two lists. The first list are it's children
00073 ///               in the tree of calls. The second list is the lines that makup
00074 ///               the call. It also holds a float representation of the return
00075 ///               value from the call.
00076 ///
00077 /// @limitations  This is a struct. It is meant as a way of combining data, but
00078 ///               it provides no encapsulation or data hiding. This has definite
00079 ///               speed benefits but sacrifices most forms of error checking.
00080 ///
00081 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00082 struct STreeCall
00083 {
00084     STreeCall();
00085     ~STreeCall();
00086 
00087     QList<STreeCall *>  s_children;
00088 
00089     QList<SGeneralMLine *>  s_lines;
00090     float               s_returnValue;
00091 
00092     SGeneralMLine *operator[](int index);
00093 };
00094 
00095 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00096 /// ITreeLine
00097 ///
00098 /// @description  The ITreeLine represents an actual line in a trace grid. The
00099 ///               different cells are returned as QStrings through the []
00100 ///               operator or they can be extracted as a list by the
00101 ///               toStringList function.
00102 ///
00103 /// @limitations  This is an Interface style structure. It is not meant to be,
00104 ///               and can not be instantiated. All subclasses must have the []
00105 ///               operator and toStringList overridden.
00106 ///
00107 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00108 struct ITreeLine
00109 {
00110     virtual ~ITreeLine();
00111     virtual QString operator[](int index) = 0;
00112     virtual QStringList toStringList() = 0;
00113 };
00114 
00115 #endif /*_STREETRACE_H_*/
